text: Donacaula pulverealis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1919. It is found in Brazil and Bolivia. The length of the forewings is about 26 mm. The forewings are light brown and the hindwings are yellowish white, irrorated with light brown toward the outer margin. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1919 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Donacaula pulverealis
